Class MP3Collection

java.lang.Object
  edu.uga.cs1302.mytunes.MP3Collection

public class MP3Collection
extends java.lang.Object

Field Summary
 SimpleArrayList<MP3File> arrayList
           
 MP3Player player
           
 
Constructor Summary
MP3Collection()
          This creates a new MP3Collection object with an empty array list.
MP3Collection(java.lang.String directoryPathname)
          This creates a new MP3Collection object that has a simple array list of contents of the directory specified as the argument, or if such a directory does not exist, then the "Music" folder of the current directory is used.

          This returns an MP3File object in the simple object array that is located at the index given as the argument in the method's parameters.

 void startPlay(int index)
          This method starts playing an MP3 file in the collection at a given index
 void stopPlay()

arrayList

public SimpleArrayList<MP3File> arrayList

player

public MP3Player player
Constructor Detail

MP3Collection

public MP3Collection()
This creates a new MP3Collection object with an empty array list.

MP3Collection

public MP3Collection(java.lang.String directoryPathname)
This creates a new MP3Collection object that has a simple array list of contents of the directory specified as the argument, or if such a directory does not exist, then the "Music" folder of the current directory is used.

Parameters:
directoryPathname - this is the directory to be referenced for the array list
Method Detail

getTableData

public java.lang.Object[][] getTableData()
This method creates an object array for the JPanel to read in values from. Each row represents a different file, and each column represents each attribute of the file.

Returns:
returns an organized object array with all of the objects data

size

public int size()
This just returns an integer value representing the size of the internal simple array list.

Returns:
the size of the array list

getFile

public MP3File getFile(int index)
                throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
This returns an MP3File object in the simple object array that is located at the index given as the argument in the method's parameters. It throws an exception if the index is, in fact, out of bounds.

Parameters:
index - this is the integer value the user wishes to obtain the object info from
Returns:
returns the MP3File object at that index in the collection
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - is thrown if the argument is out of range

startPlay

public void startPlay(int index)
               throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
This method starts playing an MP3 file in the collection at a given index

Parameters:
index - the index of the desired MP3 file to be played
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - is thrown if the index in the method parameters is not within range of the collection.

stopPlay

public void stopPlay()
This method stops the player of a collection from playing a selected file.
